column13: Adequate food. Overpriced wine list. Great drinks.
Unusual locale cuisine items, ample portions, great presentation, very well prepared and delicious, perhaps a bit pricey. Service was great without being fawning.
The place was deserted, but we had a great meal.

column4: 255 E Basse Rd Ste 940 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: This is a great place for a romantic evening or a social gathering. Be prepared to spend about $100 for 2 but it's worth it. The goat cheese is wonderful by the way.

We waited 15 minutes to have our orders taken. My wife and I each ordered a salad and a starter. It took about 20 minutes to get the salads, and 40 additional minutes to get our starters. Diners who arrived after us and ordered dinner entres received their food before we did. The waiter said that the manager apologized for the delay (didn't visit us in person) and that they'd give us 1 free dessert. Their dessert menu had 3 items. We were really disapointed, because we loved the ambience but received such poor service. I'd even written a note in my reservation that it was my wife and I's anniversary!

The food and waiter service were fantastic! But there was some odd things that didn't sit well with me. We put "birthday party!" on the notes in the reservation, and either they didn't notice or didn't think it was important. After our meal, I ordered a local brandy. I was given a glass of grappa. The waiter was quick to take the grappa back, but then a guy in a red untucked polo shirt came over and said they were out of the local brandy, and that the calvados was better. It took me a beat to realize he was the bartender! I thought it was just kind of odd.
Great location. Food/wine was amazing.
Amazing service and wine list. Cute little neighborhood with lots of bars and restaurants. Cena is definitely worth checking out. My wife recommends the lemoncellotini ;-).

The calamari was good, but not exceptional. My husband had tuna and said it was beyond bland. It wasn't a bad restaurant, but with all the great restaurants in Monterey to choose from, I wouldn't recommend it.
Great service and excellent food!
Ok food. Drink prices were outrageous. Pretty dissapointing.

column4: 600 E. Market St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: For our first visit, we went specifically for the daily buffet. We arrived @ 130P, the buffet ends @ 200P, and we NEVER felt rushed; instead, all of the food, including the beef tenderloin, lamb, chicken sausage, and the guy that carves them, stayed available until we were finished. We enjoyed *everything* that we ate. Of special note was our server, Beth - attentive but not too, friendly but not too, available but not too - we hate "hovering," and Beth was perfect in every way. She is also a genuinely interesting & delightful person. My partner and I felt completely comfortable w/ her, and w/ all of the staff @ Achiote. We will definitely return on our next visit to SA - may even go back for dinner tomorrow.
Been going there for years and never have been disappointed.
Very good food. Chef and owner attentive and friendly . Waitstaff good. Good service. Won't break the bank even with wine bottle ordered. Don' t expect anything but strip center ambience though.

column4: 1203 N Loop 1604 W  #101 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: The best flounder we've ever had! - fresh, moist and perfectly prepared with a light, delicious sauce. Our waitress was charming, friendly and extremely efficient. We highly recommend this restaurant.

Beautiful restaurant set in an old residence. Although on a busy street, it is well shielded by trees which keep the interior quiet and provide an nice view. We ate inside, but there is a nice, shaded patio dining area.
This is our favorite restaurant in Ashland - we always make sure to reserve well in advance when we attend the Shakespeare Festival each year. Dining at Amuse is one of the highlights of our visit.

Absolutely superb service and excellent food. The noise level was a bit high, and the restaurant was quite busy - I don't know that I'd recommend this for a romantic meal, but I do highly recommend it for the high quality and inventive food and the incredible service. Without a doubt I'd be happy to go again.

column1: Andre_—Ès Bouch’©e Bistro and Wine Bar
column13: Delicious! I had the Sea Bass and the waiter was very concerned that I know it was Pacific Sea bass and not Chilean. They are different fish and one if flakey and one is meaty, etc, etc. It was one of the best pieces of fish I have ever had. My husband had a seafood risotto special and was pleased, but my fish took the cake.
Always yummy food. The Thai Salad with peanut sauce dressing is the best salad in Bend. The Orange Chicken is addicting. Most dishes, including the salad are big enough to share.

column4: 9800 Hyatt Resort Drive San Antonio, TX  78251
column13: Great food and the hotel is a beautiful place to walk off that great meal!
Very nice restaurant with fantastic service.
great dining experience, we will be back.

column4: 2015 Monterey Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: My son and his family took us to dinner for my birthday. We made the reservation on line it was so easy and fast. From young to old enjoyed the whole dining experience. It was evening ,the flowers and decore was so relaxing and the lights at night added to the relaxed feeling we all had. Very friendly staff even thou they were busy it was Saturday night. All enjoyed the food something for everyones taste. I even got a birthday song and their homemade apple pie, it was a wonderful evening. We will be going again as we live near by.

column4: 3668 Lake Tahoe Blvd Ste G South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
column13: WOW! Fun times at the Apres Wine Co. The food!, wine, and service were excellent. This is a REALLY intimate setting. I'm afraid we were a wee bit rowdy (group of 6 friends who haven't seen each other in years) but the other patrons didn't seem to mind. A highly enjoyable evening.
Great view - Menu was very limited.

It was early evening, so the restaurant was still fairly quiet with very few customers. But business picked up a lot as I sat and enjoyed my dinner. The ahi tuna was cooked beautifully and tasted great. I have a weakness for parmesan fries, and Arch Rock Fish fries could definitely compete with the best. A just-spicy-enough Bloody Mary completed the meal and made me mellow. Overall, I would definitely recommend this as a great place to go in Santa Barbara
Comfortable, casual, delightful, delicious, and on selected days, they have Bocce Ball contests.

The food is absolutely outstanding - both the quality of the ingredients and the preparation/plating. Very knowledgable wait staff.The restaurant is too noisy for our liking. However, when we were moved to the back room the noise level became tolerable and we could once again hear each other speak.

column4: 7 East Anapamu Street Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: We enjoyed delicious food and attentive service. By coming a little on the early side we avoided the noise once the restaurant filled up. The setting was lovely, with a beautiful fountain centerpiece. Thank you!
The whole experience was AMAZING! I've eaten in many fine restaurants all over the world. THIS WAS THE MOST AMAZING DINNER I'VE EVER EATEN! Chef and staff, 10 star!
Out of the way restaurant. Excellent continental and German-Austrian food. Quiet, good service. Full dinner for two with wine came to $100 including tax and tip.

Aviary didn't dissapoint. My wife and I recently went there for our 10th anniversary, and the food and service were top-notch. If you like asian, french, and northwest cuisine, you'll find a lot to like at Aviary. The chefs are playful and creative, and we had numerous "mouthgasms" at this restaurant. The only real negative, which didn't bother us, is that the place is a bit loud. But we were tucked away in a relatively quiet corner and it didn't impact us much. And while the plates aren't very large, it does give you an opportunity to sample a number of dishes (they offered to split the soup for us -- which was a nice touch). Great spot on Alberta!

Food was very average. Only one or two items that I would call "tasteful!". The rest were too blend. Dining roon was way to warm. The most annoying is, waitress said "tonight all wine is 30% off". We were excited at first. Only to find out that it was just a gimmick. We ordered the first bottle of wine, a few min later waitress came back and said they were out of that. Ok , fine. We picked another one. Once again it was out. So we ordered a thrird outle. Sorry, out again. Really? On a night that you said all wine is 30% off? And just happened that the good wine is all out? We can't help but wonder this is how they decide to hide the good wine from the 30% sale. Will not go back again.
Place has really gone downhill. Do not recommend.

column4: 7166 Carmel Valley Rd. Carmel Valley, CA  93923
column13: We our from out of town.. This restaurant was highly recommend to us. We made reservations on Sunday for Tuesday night knowing it was lobster night, but when making reservations thru open table we did not know you had also reserve a lobster on that night. Thank goodness when we got there they still had two left. The for was good but our server (pretty sure her name was Veronica) did a poor job. She messed up ur whole order. We saw a manager when we first got there but not later. Probably would have enjoyed our dinner better if the service was better. When we ask for sour cream it took almost 10 minutes and the food was getting cold waiting. Asked for a salad with lettuce and cheese only and she brought out a salad with everything.

column1: Bar of America & Pacific Crest Grill
column13: Recently met friends in Truckee for dinner at the Pacific Crest Grill on a Saturday eve in April 2012 There was good menu variety, reasonable prices and good food. The grill/bar area has a nice ambience--natural wood and brick. I would recommend this restaurant for a low key evening out.
Great birthday dinner! Loved the mussels/clams pork belly entree! Yum drinks.

The food was outstanding...6 courses of culinary genius. It was even better having prepared right in front of you. The atmosphere was surprisingly fun and energetic with the two group tables, adjacent kitchen, and knowledgable staff. I highly recommend you get here as quickly as you can.

Our experience at Bella was magnificant. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and appeared to be a seasoned waiter. His service was perfect, just attentive enough. The prices were good as well. My hubby and I went for a "get away" week end and we will return. Thank you Bella

Great food! I highly recommend the Surf Side: shrimp, calamari and scallops. We actually arrived 30 minutes early and they were able to seat us. For birthday's they send you a $30 certificate to your e-mail if you sign up online. The birthday boy/girl (man/woman) gets free ice cream and a photo to take home. A fun experience!

column1: Bentley's Grill - The Grand Hotel in Salem
column13: the food and service was excellent as usual.

column4: 46840 Highway 1 Highway One at Pheneger Creek Big Sur, CA  93920
column13: Big Sur River Inn is one of our very favorite places. Sunday afternoon there is live jazz on the patio....you can bring a blanket and relax on the lawn or there are chairs in the river that flows....kids can play in the shallow river. This place is magical. It is truly a hidden gem----you would never guess about its beauty if you are just driving by the front of the establishment.

Overall we had a great experience. For the first time in a while my mom loved her dinner (she had the eggplant), I had the swordfish special which was awesome, very nice sized portion but the fish was a little over salted for my taste. The other two dishes, the ribeye and the halibut, were very good as well. There was a large group of men seated behind us which were a bit loud so it made it a bit difficult to hear across our table. The service was ok, I've definitely had better in the past. I will definitely be back, maybe for happy hour or for another special occasion.

column4: 203 S. St. Mary's St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Biga has a great reputation and for good reason. The food is above average (the oyster appetizer is fantastic) and the service is top drawer. It is rather loud and th arrangement for large parties leaves a little to be desired. However over all an excellent evening of great food and wine. I would strongly recommend it for those visiting the Alamo City.

column4: 1111 E. Cabrillo Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93103
column13: Shrimp appetizer was good. Only 3 shrimps for $15. The chicken tortilla soup could have used more kick. The soup has plenty of nice chicken in it
Small restaurant with unusual menu items, local specials. Cozy and cute.
Excellent food for both dinner/lunch! Great views and the margarita's are awesome!

My husband ordered a steak meal and it was great. I ordered a salad with steak and it was okay. There really wasn't much lettuce and I did not like a warm steak on a cool salad. The only other issue was despite it being really slow at the restaurant, our service was pretty much non existent.

column4: 926 S Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78210
column13: Our meals were delicious! We started with oyster sliders and duck egg rolls. They, along with our meals (scallops & tuna) were incredible! The atmosphere is modern, hip, and unique - highly recommend trying Bliss!! We will be back.

The ambiance is outstanding.The server also was topnotch.The starters were also very good. the let down occurred when we tasted the main courses.My wife ordered the halibut, it was so strong tasting that she was tempted to send it back to the kitchen.I ordered the chicken it was ordinary ,at best . At the prices they command ,one would expect higher quality food.

column4: 219 East Houston Street Suite 275 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was good and the service excellent. The decor is nice, but the lack of attention to detail during the construction phase of decorating is obvious. The interior design is also lacking a certain elegance that is more common in upscale dining in NY.

column4: 9 West Victoria St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: top notch food, great service, great place for special occasions, I went there for my 2 year wedding anniversary and my wife and I both enjoy it.

column4: 2815 North Loop 1604 E. San Antonio, TX  78232
column13: My favorite cajun seafood restaurant!

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Typical Texas hotel food, except probably pricier since it's a Westin.

I was impressed by the menu, wine list and the knowledge from the Bar staff. We opted to sit outside, but our server was pretty much MIA the entire time. We purchased a bottle of wine, but basically poured our own water and wine the entire time. We also had to locate the server to order more food. After we finished, we had to ask for the check. We were not charged for the wine and let the server know. The server did return with the revised check, but went MIA again. We basically had to take it up front to pay the check. Over-all, the experience could have been great if the server was attentive. Not all the tables were full, so we are not sure what happened. If we do return, we will sit inside.

So much for a review that we read. The ONLY positives about this dinning experience were the young, friendly servers (though they needed some basic training) and the young wine steward (who was very knowledgeable). The homemade pasta, purported to be excellent, defied tasting in that it was drowned in sauce, good, but the flavor was overpowering. My wife's veal piccata was, at best, average, nothing special or worth noting. Very limited wine list and nothing special about the decoration. With so many good restaurants from which to choose, I'd never return.

It was ok. We had made reservations for a group of about 20-30 for a party. The process of making reservations and working with Annette was good. However, they don't have air conditioning and we were there on one of the hottest days of summer. It was very warm in there. The service was slow. I only tried two items and found the food to be ok but not great.

We had a 6:00 reservation. We were the only ones there. Another couple came in during our stay & ate on the patio. We started out there, but it was too windy and traffic noise was too much. I ordered farm salad and duck legs and my husband the soup and meat loaf. The soup and salad were good, as well as the bread. The grilled veggies we both had were good too. But, the duck and meat loaf were over done. Yes, the duck "fell off the bone," like the waiter said, but it was dry and cooked with a burnt sugar "glaze" that was so strong I couldn't taste any duck flavor. And I did not the care at all for the confeit. The meat loaf had the same glaze & was just okay. I like the idea of using products from local farmers, but we won't be back.
Excellent! We were pleasantly surprised not knowing anything about this resturant. Highly recommend it!

column4: 1037 Monterey St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: It is a bit better in all aspects other than ambiance than Cafe Roma. We've been to both several times and both are consistently good.
Interesting and varied menu consisting of small, medium, and large plates. Delicious preparations. A real treat.

column1: Caf’© Beach Restaurant at Beach Resort Monterey
column13: My boyfriend and I went to dinner, hoping for some good seafood. I ordered the sea bass, which was delicious and perfectly cooked, while he had the salmon. I think that salmon was the worst I have ever tasted. It was dry, flavorless and just not very good. The red pepper coulis that went along with it was also flavorless. The garlic mashed potatoes were good, but we didn't spend $20+/entree for mashed potatoes. I suppose we should have complained, but our waiter was not around much.The view was amazing, as we were right on the water, so I guess we were paying for the ambiance. It's unfortunate that the food wasn't better because we wanted to like this place.In the end, I guess I would recommend it but with hesitation.

This is our second visit to Cafe Fina and it was as good as we remembered it from our last visit. We are from out of the area and think this is one of the best seafood and Italian restaurants in Monterey. The service is excellent.
We love going here whether it's just my husband and me for a romantic tryst or with the kids.

column4: 1020 Railroad Ave San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Always the number one choice for bringing guests and for quality dining.
Everything was great except it was too noisy inside seating. They have outside dining which would have been better, however, would have had to wait an additional 30 minutes from the reservation time/
Ok food, great beer list and location

column4: Dolores St. between Ocean and 7th Carmel, CA  93921
column13: slightly expensive but overall a good valuevery good foodnice atmosphere butway too loud--can't hear person across the tableexcellent professional staffglad I ate there and would do it again

We love Cappy's and keep coming back but for the for the first time we were Very disappointed in the food. Table ordered Swordfish x 2, Mustang Chicken and the Texas Platter. We were all very disappointed. Appetizers were wonderful but all 4 of us felt our entrees were very bland despite the nice presentation. Service was very very good as usual but food substandard
Great bartenders the chef if amazing. I travel for work and this is one of my favorite places on the West Coast now

We came to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary here and were not disappointed. What a joy to sit down with our group of friends and have our very attentive waiter start bringing us delicious and creative little nibbles. Creative combinations, fabulous textures, and beautiful presentation all came together in very delicious and exciting food. The wine selection looked fabulous, however we brought our own bottles, and to our great surprise, the restaurant comped our corkage as an anniversary gift to us. All in all, a very lovely evening at a very special restaurant!

column4: 1212 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: Consistently enjoyable meals and atmosphere.
Waitresses need to be trained, had to ask for everything three times, and no cheese for pasta. Also, the reported to Open Table that we did not dine.

Food is good and service is usually great. This time the service was good. The sides are a little expensive for what you get that I recommend sharing one. They do give some nice goodies at the end which is nice.

The staff at Chart House went above and beyond to make our evening special. I called ahead and told them that my fiance and I were introducing our parents and we hoped to have a good seat. Not only did they do that, but they also printed out special menus congratulating us and we got a really cool dessert to help us celebrate. Plus.. the food was absolutely amazing, the drinks were delicious and our waiter was truly talented. Chart House in Lake Tahoe is one amazing place and I highly recommend it!

column4: 106 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
column13: The food was good, steak not prepared as ordered and had to redo but rest was very good. Service was over the top good. Have not had a bad meal at The Chart House.
Well-run, upscale restaurant with great view of Monterey coast. Food was very good, service also.
Best spinach salad in town. Very nice seafood

column1: Chart House Restaurant - Tower of the Americas
column4: 601 Tower of the Americas Way San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Excellent dining experience. The only drawback was the wait for our reservation. The reservation was for 7:30 and we didn't get seated for a little over an hour. It was Saturday night and I requested a window table. When we were finally were seated, we were directed to a booth across from the window that would have seated at least six. I told the host that we were only a party of two and would like what we requested. We were promptly seated at a window table for two. The hour wait was spent in the bar and it was very nice too. I had looked at the menu on line and had an idea what I wanted. We ordered and one of the entrees ordered was not available and the dessert we were looking forward to, the souffle, was also not available.

What a great recommendation by locals. We were given the bet seat in the house. The p,ace got noisy as it filled but not too much so. The food was excellent as was the service. The owner visited every table..great attention to details. A must.
Everything here was amazing! The view, the food, the service, the other customers! We will definitely be back again!
I know this place for long long time. Still the Mama cooks and the food is great. I am not too sure about the live music though.
This was our third visit to Cielito and the upscale and authtentic Mexican food keeps us coming back for more.
We had a booth around the perimeter of the restaurant which were very private and quiet, plus the food and service was excellent.

This was our first time at Cilantro's. Although we've passed by many times over the years, our loyalty has been divided between 2 other local Mexican restaurants. Now we realize what we've been missing!! The food was delicious - fresh, beautifully presented and loads of it. Nobody leaves Cilantro's hungry and we noticed thar most people were carrying boxes with their leftover dinners. The atmosphere is very casual -not a dressy place - so it's the place to go when you don't feel like dressing up and where you won't feel out of place, whatever you wear. The staff were friendly and patient (I took a while to make up my mind!) and the Margaritas were delicious. We're looking forward to returning very soon.

column4: 150 East Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Great food all around.Shrimp appetizers were plentiful and filling. 1 order was enough for two.Tomato salad was also delicious.Kristi, our waitress, recommended the Snapper which was very good and complemented by the caramelized onion and whatever type of grain it was served over.The original bottle of wine I ordered was out of stock but she recommended an excellent replacement. Which we went out and bought a bottle for the house.Thank you Kristi for your excellent service and charming personality.Slight draw back was the extreme quietness of the restaurant. There was no low playing or mild mood music and I could hear nearby conversations. The clanking of people dining was also noticeable due how quiet it was.

column4: 343 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
column13: We always make it a point to eat here when we vacation in Mammoth. It's a family run business with great food and sincere appreciation for you patronage.

Clarklewis is truly one of the finest restaurants in Portland, and these days, that is quite an accomplishment. I took my family of 4 (including 2 bottomless teens) for a night of fine dining, and everything on the Italian-esque menu was superb. We ordered the $55/person tasting menu (everyone at the table has to go for it) and they brought literally everything on the menu - 3 or 4 appetizers, salads, pastas, entres, and desserts. We had to take some home in a box - with my boys and fine dining, that may be the first time ever!

As always, Cocotte came through with a fantastic dining experience. Food and service were both exemplary as we've come to expect. We don't understand why there is not always a line out the door of this place! Do Portlanders really know anything about good food??? Hmmmmm.

Loved it! The food was mouthwatering and I liked everything. The service was amazing, our server brought us recommended wine with our dishes to try. He was always on top of everything. Our glasses were always full and he made sure we had a good transition from the main to the dessert.

Daily grill is only worth going to if you are staying at the Westin and do not have the energy to go elsewhere. With a few exceptions in the bar area most of the wait staff are slower than what I would expect. Also the food is a little pricey for what it is.

My wife and I went there for our anniversary. As always, we were treated as though they did not have anyone else but us to worry about. The menu was sharp and the wine discussion with our server was just what we needed. The food was excellent and we ended up sharing each other's plate. Dessert was suggested and well done. Afterwards, we went downstairs and just hung out in the wine bar with some Port and Scotch. The service here too was excellent. Great place to eat!
We went for lunch and it was very good. The only bad thing was they had music going and volume was too loud. It was hard to talk.
Too loud, they didn't do anything special that I request for our anniversary and they mixed our drinks up.

column4: 136 SW Washington Ave STE 102 Corvallis, OR  97333
column13: We sat outside and it was a beautiful day. Only four tables outside and service wasn't stellar which has been my experience in the past. I think they had a large party that maybe was slowing things down. I really like Del Alma however and will return.
good visual presentations of delicious food choicesdo not look for a mango daiquiryquick service and friendly waiters
We had an excellent experience for my friend's birthday. Excellent service for our large group and the food, as always, was wonderful.
Food was amazing for the multi-course tasting option. Server was a little curt and when speaking would trail off so that made it a little difficult to understand her.

Enjoyed our dinner, service was excellent and fish was tremendous. Had spot prawns that were caught only a few hours earlier. Restuarant makes their own Lemoncello. Sat by windw with a view of the sea lions.
Fabulous food and the service was great!! Highly recommend.

We returned to Dragonfly for dinner last night. We each had an entree. Food was good but no "Mmmm" moments. The heirloom tomato soup could have been Campbell's, with extra pepper added. The steak portion size left my husband hungry. My ahi dish lacked the savory flavor I anticipated from a Mediterranean meal, but the portion size was good.

Not your typical Chinese restaurant - decor is elegant, service is attentive but not intruding, food is expertly prepared and a delight to the eyes as well as the palate. We ordered four entrees for four (rice is not included). Each of us raved about three of the dishes and were less enthusiastic about the fourth - but each of us had different three favorites.

column4: 18740 Stone Oak Parkway San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Awesome service and food. Standout was attention to detail.
Unorganized wait staff. Our host/waitress was rude and not helpful. She seemed as if she didn't want to be there.

I have eaten in a good many restaurants over the past four decades and it is always disappointing when the front of the house does not do justice to the kitchen. Edgar's suffers from this affliction. The food was very good, nice layering of flavors, perfect temperature, and decent variety. This is the reason that I would go back.

This is a TRULY OUTSTANDING restaurant from the food, service, ambiance - the whole package. Memorable, worthy of many repeat performances ! The views are remarkable, the food fresh, beautifully prepared and presented, service attentive, friendly and not overbearing.
Me and my wife to dinner here for no specific reason but we had a good time and didn't want to leave until the end of the night. The music was good and i will be back again!

column4: 2555 NW Campus Village Way Bend, OR  97701
column13: I love Elevation! It is an extremely enjoyable experience being served by the students. The food was tasty and well-presented. I give Elevation nothing but high marks.

Our adult daughter was in visiting from Austin and my husband, daughter and I had a very good evening at the Enterprise Company last Monday evening. We enjoyed salads as a first course (Caesar and Apple-Pecan) and everyone was happy. We all then had a house specialty - Ciopinno - which was delicious - filled with seafood and fish were plentiful in a tasty tomato broth.The wonderful sourdough bread reminded us of our earlier days in San Francisco. We will be back!
Staff was friendly. Food was very good, I enjoyed watching my son's eye light up when they flamb’©ed the dish called The Olympic Touch table side. It was my wife birthday, she enjoyed it very much.
Erna's is a special treat we all should experience at least once.
A local place to see for the bar. On that note, menu is limited, fried bar food. View and ambiance are the highlight here.
Love McClintocks! Onion rings, and sides all come with your entree - unique compared to steak houses in large cities (i.e. Ruth's Chris) where all sides are charged separate.
we had a long dinner ticket time and the bar did not have strawberrys for drinks

The Fish Hopper has some of the best clam chowder my husband and I have ever had. The restaurant has great views of the bay and the staff is friendly. I had the Parmesan crusted Sea Bass special and my husband had the maple soy glazed skirt steak. Both dishes were delicious. It's a good place to grab lunch or have a nice dinner.

The food quality is very good and prepared in clever ways. It is priced properly. This is a great go-to restaurant for a fresh, simple, tasty meal. We continue to return and always find delicious specials featuring seasonal foods.

column4: 315 First Street Suite 201 Lake Oswego, OR  97034
column13: This is a very good seafood restaurant, but quite noisy. My husband and I opted to sit outside which turned out to make the evening a wonderful time for us. We were then able to truly enjoy the delicious food and our time together.

column4: On 6th Avenue between Dolores & San Carlos Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Service was excellent, they were attentive and "watched out" for us the entire meal.

column4: 375 SW Powerhouse Drive STE 130 Bend, OR  97702

It is one of our favorite spots in Bend. Outdoor seating in summer and a nice warm and cozy atmosphere in the winter with fireplace. All ingredients very fresh.

I was there with my daughters for a special dinner and the 3 of us noted there seemed to be more stimulation then at other similar restaurants.I will go back though, FYI. Great overall.

We had a very enjoyable dinner, great waiter.

column4: 14439 NW Military Highway Suite 100 San Antonio, TX  78231
column13: As usual, food and service were wonderful. I had the lamb chops - so delicious! One of my dining partners had the stuffed chicken and she was very happy with her entree. Will definitely be back!

Overall it was pretty good. Service was extremely slow. Salmon dish with fried rice balls was a disappointment. Fish was overcooked and over sauced. We had a nice time overall and the appetizers were good.

column4: 1215 Avila Beach Dr. San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
column13: This was our first visit and we will return---we ate in the bar area which was both romantic and cozy. The full menu was available there as well as a bar menu. The staff was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. My wife had breast of chicken which was both generous and moist. I had a pasta dish, tagliatelle with vegetables that was excellent. For the full menu, except to pay in the mid 20 to low 30 dollar range but for a nice/special dinner, it was well worth it.

column4: 450 Marsh Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: A very nice Italian restaurant in a old Victorian house. They were not busy on the week night we dined and the noise level was low so be could enjoy our friends without shouting. The patio was very nice, heated and out of the wind so it was very comfortable outside. Our food was good but not exceptional. Our party of 4 had three different items so we got a good sampling of menu items. We had recently dined at Gina's in Arroyo Grande and found the food to be better than Gennaro's.
Overall a very good experience. All courses were delicious & interesting. Service was excellent. A really enjoyable evening

I'd never known of Gilda's until we had a gift certificate given us. The place is very romantic, the paintings envelope one in the encircled restaurant, the food is divine. Homemade pasta and cannol made the Sicilian way with ricotta. Definitely a great find.We'll be back.

LOVE this little gem. On the edge of the Pearl District, we stumbled upon Gilt out first night in Portland. We THOUGHT we were foodies until Gilt... Both the bartender and the chef broadened our horizons in the most fascinating and delicious ways. Recommend the Bocadillo cocktail. It is "out there" but fits right in in Portland!

The menu here is split between a couple of dozen "small plates" $6-$14 each and 8 larger dinners (mid-$20). This works very well for smaller appetites like ours. It also encourages sharing, which we did, by ordering 3 small plates and a dinner. All food was exceptionally well prepared and had the perfect balance of flavours. Wine list was not extensive, but more than adequate and priced mid-range. The ambience is very quiet and the restaurant furnishings are very comfortable. Only warning is that this place is more about quality than quantity, so those with larger appetites, used to "meat & potatoes", may not feel satisfied. But we loved it so much, we're looking forward to returning very soon.

column4: NW Corner of 6th & Mission Ave. Carmel, CA  93921
column13: The last time we were at Grasings the service was terrible...the maitre d was unfriendly and not at all wecoming. We had a good brunch, but don't know that we'll go back with so many other friendly,good restaurants in Carmel.

Being from out of town, we wanted to end our trip to Bend with a nice dinner out. We picked the right place. Making online reservations was easy and allowed us to be seated right away even during the dinner rush. All of the staff & servers were friendly & professional. The setting was beautiful - river view while the sun was setting. Food was delicious - lots of appetizers and specials to choose from. So happy we saved room for dessert! It was a great way to end our vacation and we'll be back next time we visit Bend.

We had spent time in Bavaria and loved the better-than-native dishes prepared at Gruner. Our server was excellent in explaining and recommending wine and food pairings. We were more than pleased with the fresh tomato salad, charcuterie, and the lamb and duck entrees. What a welcome change from the excellent but now common fresh food NW cuisine in Portland **** restaurants.
The food was amazing. We had the truffle fries, salmon, steak and soup along with dessert and everyone was satisfied.

We had a largish group (12 people), and there weren't enough people on duty - it took 40 minutes before our order was taken, and another 50 minutes before we were served. Our waiter was cute and courteous, but he simply wasn't able to keep up with us and everybody else that was there that night.
Notable wine list, but very expensive. We are locals and noticed it was all tourists in the restaurant. Need local specials!

Food was good, polite staff but they werenäó»t very attentive. When we were seated they were very helpful but after ordering we didnäó»t see our waitress but once. The ohter thing is they need much better high chairs, a small strap across their legs just above the knee doen't work very well to contain a toddler.

Many thanks again, Il Cortile, for great service, always delicious food. Thank you also for making us very welcomed. We will be back. That's for sure.

column4: Ocean Avenue & Monte Verde St Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Great food and ambiance, but impossibel to find. Called the restuarant for directions which only got us more lost. However, the food was worth the effort.

We have been in Portland for 12 years living on a teachers salary we don't often get to sample the higher end restaurants. After much study for our anniversary we picked Iorios. It was a smashing success. Great atmosphere, the waitstaff were attentive without hovering, The owner, Chris, visited every table and welcomed everyone, but all that aside it is really about the food which was wonderful. My husband is spoiled by my cooking and would rather eat at home, I love going out. The food at Iorios satisfied both of us. Please go, you will not be disappointed.
First time eating here and we will be back in again this week! :) Lovely little brunch with the family. Food was delicious. I can't wait to try everything else!
Great place to have a snack & listen to music. Food is not that special.

Thought we were lucky to get a reservation in downtown Monterey during the auctions, races, etc. for a party of six. And this was at the Portola Hotel where the RM auction was being held. The resturant was pretty empty when we arrived and I guess I know why now. The service was horrible and the food was fair. Some of our party liked their entry and some did not, saying it was nothing special. Too bad because this is a great location. Will not return.
Great place to share NW cuisine with local or traveling family members and friends.
we enjoyed it and the staff was wonderful

column4: 780 North Lake Boulevard Tahoe City, CA  96145
column13: Service and ambiance was great. Unfortunately, the fish I ordered was so incredibly dry, as was the risotto. Maybe it was a bad night for the chefs? I'll definitely go back to try Jake's again,
The food was phenomenal. The tuna tartare was fresh and the flavors blended so well. The staff is very friendly, and extremely knowledgeable. We'll definitely go back.
We went on a Tuesday night about 730. Restaurant was very quiet but the service and food were very good. So don't know about noise .
The service was excellent. I liked the atmosphere. I will be back. Thanks
The fish of the day with the barbeque is funky. They did not have our table for the right time and wanted to sit us 30 min later even though it was not busy. Might go back.
Hands down one of the best meals I've had in PDX ever!
Wonderful menu filled with organic and locally produced ingredients. Every dish was excellent and the service was fantastic. Beautiful view overlooking the golf course. Incredible Brunch!

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - Cibolo Moon
column13: The wine list is very limited.... very few choices if you are into wine. The menu is also limited. Very pleasant atmosphere and decor... nice view of the JW Marriott grounds.

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - High Velocity
column13: We were just going to eat & have some drinks, then the Hostess let me know about a Special Beer Pairing Dinner. So glad she did. We had a group of 6 & we all had a Fabulous time! We will definitely be going again! Thanks!
Everything was perfect...food, service, atmosphere and the jazz band that was playing was an added plus for the evening! Thank you!

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway The Shops At La Cantera San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Enjoyed the food and service! My dining companion had the pork loin, which I had a bite of, it was delicious! I had the mac-nut chicken, so tasty, reminded me of Hawaii! We will definitely return to Kona to try other dishes.
I ordered a glass of wine from the menu. They were out. I ordered a steak from the menu. They were out. This restaurant needs to improve.

We went here on a whim. Best decision we made. The food was fantastic. My husband, who is a chef, had the steak. To him, a steak is a steak is a steak. But THIS steak, was outstanding! It was cooked to perfection, was seasoned right and was so tender. The frites were awesome too! I had to roasted chicken which, again, was perfect. It fell off the bone.I highly recommend going. Service, food and atmosphere was great!

column1: La Cascada - The Resort at Tapatio Springs
column13: We celebrated our anniversary at La Cascada and had a wonderful time. The food was excellent and the vie outstanding.

column4: 2415 N. Main Ave San Antonio, TX  78212
column13: Way above expectations in every way.
Unprepossesing place in modest surroundings, but the food and service are highly commendable.

Simply the best meal and wait staff I have ever had the pleasure to have a meal with !Had particular requirements for one person in our party, and they wentTotally out of their way to accommodate our needs.Not the first time here, and will NOT be the last.

I have come here many times, both with my boyfriend or with the addition of another couple as well. We have received good service in the past, but the past trip was off. When we got there we were checked in, as we are obviously hoping to be checked in and not be penalized by opentable, and we were seated immediately. Our server came over and told us some specials and then ignored us for 15-20 minutes. When she came back over and I made a note of this, not only were they out of what my boyfriend wanted to order then, she became combative with me, I was the problem apparently. She then went and checked the computer after we ordered and came back and said "for the record it was 15 minutes since you came in"... wow. Love the food, but wow.

column4: 2520 Columbia House Blvd. Suite 108 Vancouver, WA  98661
column13: Service was great as usual. We ordered off the happy hour menu this time and it was an incredible value with normal size plates. Not smaller sizes as some places. The Friday night bar and happy hour is crowded but they do an exceptional job of getting people seated. Happy hour is at all seats not just the bar.

column1: Larks - Home Kitchen Cuisine at The Ashland Springs Hotel
column13: As always, a most pleasant experience. It's tourist season here now and the restaurant was very busy at lunch time. But I still enjoyed every minute while there. I have a volunteer job at OSF, greeting visitors and answering questions about the theaters and Ashland. I always recommend Lark's because I know how much being at Lark's will add to the experience of a visit to Ashland and OSF.

We've brunches and dined at Las Canarias many times in our frequent visits to San Antonio.. It deserves the high praise it has garnered on this site, Zagat guides and elsewhere. Incredible service with thoughtfully, well prepared food. Really a gem of San Antonio dining!

column4: 306 West Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: This is a great place for Spannish food. While the Paella is not as good as my last trip to Spain it certainly a great choice in San Antonio. The tapas were well thought out and tasty; there was an even assortment between vegetable adn meet; the standard offereings such as Jambon were there as well as unusal ones.

column4: 120 Country Club Drive Ste 29 Incline Village, NV  89451
column13: One of the top 5 best meals I've ever had. If I am ever in the Tahoe area again, I will go out of my way to eat here. Delicious!
Three 20+ year olds, two 40+ year olds and a 12 year old were all impressed by the quality of food and the quality of service. Enough said.

Cigare Volant is a paragon of contemporary cuisine in an unassuming location. Next to gigantic barrels, you enter a converted warehouse now used for wine making, tasting, and beer brewing, right across from railroad tracks. The inside hasn't changed since it was the Tasting Room and still consists of exquisite transformations of wine-making detritus. However. the food is quite a bit different. Dishes are smaller and more naturally shared, and techniques such as foams and shells created from liquid nitrogen fit in. The tastes are still the best in Santa Cruz, and as expected there's still the commitment to local farms and fresh, in-season ingredient.s
Amazing food and service!! One of the best meals I've had. Get the foie gras profiteroles, you won't be sorry! Great foodie restaurant without being stuffy.

column4: Dolores St. between Ocean & 7th Avenue Carmel-By-The-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Outstanding place cruising just below the radar here in Carmel, it over delivers! Food was as good as I've had anywhere in France. Prices are too low for the quality and portions as well as service...An incredible find!!! If they opened a place in Laguna Beach- I'd be in heaven!

column13: Very good food despite misunderstanding from waitress when ordering food. Received a free dessert for the inconvenience which was much appreciated for the extra waiting time. Very professional service and a great place in the area.

Very good food. Service spotty. Very warm evening and sat outside. Not all workers knowledgable about the menu. Had classic ceviche. Very generous portion, but almost too much lime juice. Had octopus potato appetizer. Very nice presentation and great flavor, but octopus a little chewy. Cau Cau for entree which was excellent, but rice was a little underdone. Reasonably priced.

column4: 3808 N Williams Ave Ste 127 Portland, OR  97227-1468
column13: Lincoln continues to be one of my all time favorites, especially for visiting guests.

this was our first time dining at Little Bird. We are foodies and we loved the food. We had the trout and the duck and both were excellent, beautifully prepared and presented. This restaurant will become a favorite of ours.

We took my dad there for Father's Day brunch and the food,setting and service were all fabulous. We all tried something different from Eggs Benedict, The Reuben, Crabcake Salad, Lox, Sausage Trio plate and my 2 year old especially loved the mac n cheese fritters. We will certainly be back. We had fun feeding the ducks across the street when we were finished too. 5 Stars across the board!

column1: Lodge Restaurant at Carmel Valley Ranch
column13: Chef Tim Wood knows his products and he will prepare you a once in a lifettime food experience!

OK Mexican food, but nothing to write home about. The hostess was clueless about OpenTable, so the reservation was pointless. Fortunately, they had room for us. The dining room was dark and windowless; the fajitas ordered by a large group smoked up the whole room: there was poor air circulation. The server was friendly.
Wonderful food and happy to help with gluten free dining! Will definitely come back.

column1: Louie_—Ès Cajun Kitchen and Bourbon Bar
column13: The food was delicious. we were there on a Tuesday night and it was pretty quiet sans for a few tables, and some guys watching sports at the bar. I had swordfish that was flavored and cooked perfectly. If you are looking for a nicer meal in a more casual town like Santa Cruz, this is a great place!
Had a great meal. I think people sometimes forget that Luce provides a great dining experience. If you haven't tried it in a while, you should go again.

column13: We kept passing this restaurant and wanted to try it, even though our hotel didn't recommend it. It's definitely a local hangout. It was literally a lump of bland steak cut in four pieces on a bed of mixed greens absolutely drowning in balsamic. Partner's dish was equally disappointing. Only food worth mentioning was the broccolini. $120 for steak salad, glass of wine, turkey burger, side dish and a diet coke!

Such a pleasant location for a meal. All staff very attentive, friendly and ready to accomodate. Service was attentive, ready to please. A real feel good place. If you want to treat yourself, I would highly recommend this restaurant.

The Tapas thing I'm not really a fan of, but they have great food. Many interesting fusions of different cultures but they make it work so well! I must say, we tried many items from their menu and I don't think you can go wrong with anything they offer.
We had a wonderful dinner and our waiter was very attentive. It was our 38th wedding anniversary and they printed our anniversary date on the menu. We will certainly be back.

Made reservations at Madison's Grill for a group of 15 folks looking for a great lunch spot. We were a little late, no problem! The service provided by Madison's staff was great, very friendly. Everyone enjoyed the food, especially the onion rings.

column13: While in Carmel we always look forward to dining at Marinus. The menu has changed since we were here last Christmas and so has the decor in the dining room. However, the food continues to be delicious and beautifully presented by a courteous and coordinated staff.

column4: 2757 Shell Beach Rd Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: Like so many hotel, and "view" restaurants (can't beat the gorgeous view of the Pacific Ocean and Pismo/Avila Bay, especially from the outdoor patio!), the food (and sometimes service) seems to take a "back seat" here! The servers really SEEM to try to do a good job, but our food came out slowly, for the most part, and some things were better than others. I've eaten here a few times before, sometimes with better success than at this dinner. But for example, having had breakfast there, too (earlier the same day), they brought out my Eggs Benedict with NO MEAT on it! Granted, they corrected the problem quickly, and BOTH versions (which I got to eat!) were very tasty, but that's pretty basic!I can recommend, but with limited expectations!
Enjoyable dinner with family and friends. Surf and turf great. Service good.

This was my first Masu dining experience and i was completely "wow'd" from the appetizers to the sake selections. The waitress gladly recommended her own favorites when we asked. Which all turned out to great pics! I'm already planning my return tripz Awesome! Make sure you try the mount saint helenz sushi roll!! You'll be surprise how awesome the dish is!

column4: 340 East Basse Road, Suite 101 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: LOVED the food!! I thought about it the whole next day!!! The happy hour prices were not so happy, but the food more than made up for the price of the wine.
The food and service was the best I've had in at a restaurant in a long time.
The food does not justify the prices..

This was a 3rd time at Meriwether's--other 2 were for lunch. The service was very good compared to lunch slowness and incompetence. The waiter was helpful, and paid attention to our needs without intruding. Too bad they were out of the specials by our 8:00 pm reservation. We did have to wait for half an hour, even though the table we were seated at was sitting empty from the time we came in, not sure what that was about except the hostess seemed scattered and not on top of the turn overs. The patio ambiance was magical. Be aware, the portions are tiny from the boards up to full entrees, so expect to do 3-4 courses to be full. Overall a pleasant experience with friends.
I took my husband here for his birthday. We loved it! Everything was delicious, and very beautifully presented. This place is a keeper!

Unusual fusion of Mexican & Italian cuisine. The dishes were very good, having a number of the smaller plates in order to sample, could not get enough. Menus was extensive, all fresh ingredients. The calamari & chorizo pizza were just two that were fabulous, must visit & experience.

Service was very poor. We were a group of 6 and we sat outside and felt we were forgotten all night. Had to request for everything utensils, bread etc. Four of the six meals came out together and the other two came late. I was celebrating my birthday and my dish was one of the ones that was served late. When my meal did arrive it was cold and unappetizing. Also there heat lamps were not working. Unfortunately we were sat by the heat lamp that didn't work. Michael's was hosting a high school reunion that night and it was a busy night and perhaps that is why the service was so poor. However, I believe they should have planned for the extra business.

We've been coming in for a few years and have never been disappointed. The only reason we don't come more often is because we'd order everything. We always find something new to try and have loved each discovery.
It's one of my favorite restaurants in the burbs. The staff is welcoming, warm, friendly, and offer great service.

This restaurant was very romantic and perfect for our special occasion. The food was good, but the portions were very small. We enjoyed the service and beautiful views, but we were still hungry when we left. I would recommend this restaurant for special occasions but plan on small portions of food.

column4: 16165 SW Regatta Lane, STE 1000 Beaverton, OR  97006
column13: food and service were GREAT! we will be going back for sure! The waiter was very friendly and honest when asked about menu.

They are having a rough start. They have changed the menu and have added Saturday and Sunday brunch which is nice. My husband and I like to go in the late afternoon for our favorite pizza.. and bottle of local Santa Barbara chardonnay. Highly recommend the pizza's if you go. It's nice to sit by the fireplace inside.. or outside on the patio.
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday and we both absolutely loved it. The food was incredible and the place was very classy. Loved the whole experience.
Had a blast, food was great and ambiance was perfect.

Great spot for a upscale birthday celebration- no singing but they take a souvenir photo (like on a cruise) and provide a complimentary dessert. Service was great and the jumbo shrimp were the best my husband has ever had. Thanks for a memorable celebration!

column4: 300 E. Crockett Street Suite 283 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Staff was exceptional. First class service.

column4: 10003 NW Military Hwy, Ste 2101 San Antonio, TX  78231

Stephanie is a super server and the extra touches I requested went off beautifully! Myron's always goes above and beyond!

column8: Hill Country out of New Braunfels
column13: We were in town celebrating my husbands birthday, and it was the perfect place for a romantic dinner.

column4: 312 Pearl Parkway Bldg 2 Suite 2102 San Antonio, TX  78215
column13: This was our second trip to NAO and the results were mixed compared to our first trip. My wife thought the food was better,I thought it was slightly inferior. The biggest problem was it was very slow (2 hours for three courses) despite the fact it was almost empty. This may portend problems on weekends! As before the quality of ingredients was excellent. The jicama tacos were very refreshing.The octopus appetizer was very good, and the duck confit was excellent. Dinner partners gave their dishes similar praise.

Everything about Natural Selection was excellent except one thing: the temperature inside the restaurant. It was a rare, hot summer night in Portland and the restaurant was stifling. It nearly ruined our meal. I'm not saying I won't go back, but I will be careful of the weather. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this restaurant to vegetarians looking for something different and folks who are into food.
Lovely summer dinner, the waitstaff was friendly but unobtrusive and the dining room is adorable.

column4: 2865 NW Town Center Loop Beaverton, OR  97006
column13: This location is best for meeting family from multiple locations. The whole dining experience is great.

We had a group of 17 (from White Rock, Canada) and went to the Newport seafood Grill to celebrate finishing the Seattle to Portland bike ride. The service and food were excellent - especially given that we had such a large group! Thanks for accommodating such a large group!

Service was mediocre. I had to ask three times for a refill of iced tea, and by the time they brought it I had finished my dinner. When we arrived, we waited 4 minutes for anyone to come to the front and greet us. The bartender and one server looked directly at us but didn't even acknowledge our existence. The food was done wrong the first time, but they quickly made it right. Food was good so I'll give them another chance, but the service will definitely need to step up a notch!

column4: 1111 East Burnside Fourth Floor Portland, OR  97214
column13: What a great place! Food is great, service is fun and attentive , wonderful views , love the decor !!! All good! Our European guest was blown away, We'll be back!
Ask for outdoor dining and was place at a table in front of the restaurant on the street. Very noisey. For some reason picked a steak and it was fair at best. Tough with little flavor.

column4: 726 Higuera Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: A really great place to go to impress a date, boss, in-laws. Funky fresh without being stuffy.
Really good food, from appetizers to entrees to desserts. Great bread with olive oil/garlic dips (two different kinds of each). Good quiet relaxed service.
Loved it, and they give special consideration to military in uniform. Desserts are amazing!

I love the atmosphere of the Old San Francisco...so friendly, warm, fun, and so unique. A beautiful bar and the girl swinging and hitting the bell are just a part of the fantastic ambience. But what was particularly amazing was the quality of ALL the dishes we tried, not just the steaks! Amazing food at such a reasonable price. Other steak houses charge much more for the steak and all the sides are extra. But OSF provides a salad and your choice of 2 side dishes with your steak...all for less than you would pay just for the steak at other fine steakhouses. We definitely will return to try other dishes. We highly recommend this place without reservation!

column1: Oro at The Emily Morgan Hotel
column4: 705 E Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Went on a Friday night, we're just looking for a decent place for dinner. Menu on website was not what was available, but we did not have a hard time finding things to eat. Food was delicious. Service left a little bit to be desired, but wouldn't keep us from going back. Very cool building. Definitely recommend giving it a try.

column4: 212 W. Crockett St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: It was a totally enjoyable experience. The staff were very attentive, the menu was creative, and the food was well prepared. I normally dine outside, but the temperature was a bit high for some of my guests. I can see that this would be a wonderful experience, seasonally.

column4: 1401 N Loop 1604 W Suite 105 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Steaks were very pricy but all other things on the menu were very reasonable. Very nice place.
Our last meal at Osteria Sfizio, as it now has a new name. We are hoping for the same wonderful food and atmosphere in the future.
Great cocktails and happy hour menu. Air conditioning was weak on very hot day--so we were eager to leave as it was uncomfortably warm, but the food would take me back.

column4: 233 East Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Staek was prepared as ordered.Patrick is the Perfect waiter. Everyone should ask for him.
Thanks Nelly!! Well done as always!!

Great food - every dish was cooked perfectly and the ambiance was quaint and relaxed, but classy. LOVED the champagne-and-kir drink. The menu has a much-welcome variety: plenty of vegetarian options as well as meat entrees. The rigatoni and ravioli were great, and even simpler items like the "delicious salad" were something a little special. Attentive service, and we much enjoyed the outdoor seating for an early dinner.

The service is fir for a foodie and also for a kid. There The food is very memorable fresh and always generous portions. Right after the beach it's a great place to go on a date with and for a first date all dressed up.
Although the food was good the menu was lacking.Paragon was a disapointent the second time around.

Amazing place. I booked the reservation a few months before traveling based on the reviews on the OpenTable website. We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and travel to Portland, OR from Seattle, WA for the weekend. The waitstaff were courteous and polite. We ordered from the appetizer/small plate section and everything we had was superb -- from the cucumber soup with shrimp to tuna salad or the flank steak salad. The double chocolate tart with hazelnut ice cream was the perfect was to end the evening.

We were expecting a lot based reviews. However, Passionfish in our opinion failed to live up to these reviews. While the menu is different and very interesting we felt everything was just ok. We had the roasted beet salad. It was again ok. Nothing special. Also we had the starter, Salmon Ceviche..again..ok. For dinner we both ordered the scallops, which everyone raves about in the reviews. We both found the scallops (at least the larger ones) undercooked. That really didn't sit well with us. IF I ever went back, which I wouldn't, I certainly would not order this dish again. For dessert we shared the Banana bread pudding and the lemon creme brulee. YUM. Sorry Passionfish we really wanted to like you. Maybe just go for dessert.

There are two rooms in this restaurant. I had made reservations several weeks prior, and initially was put in front room. This room has no ambience. The other room has an open kitchen and fireplace and much better ambience. I was able to change rooms although with reluctance. (turns out were several empty tables during entire time). So I recomend asking for inner room.

I was disappointed in the service this time. It took so much time to even get a glass of water. I'm not sure why, but it seemed we were just a bother to them. I wondered if they were just angry that we used OpenTable to make the reservation.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Suite 22200 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Clearly one of the top two meals of this type I have eaten in San Antonio in the last 10 years. Every course was better than the one before. Great service, flexible atmosphere.
The best and most friendly service I've had in the U.S.A. (Thanks, Jos’©) Food was good. The portions are massive, you could dine on a starter and not go away hungry. In all, a very enjoyable meal.

column4: 255 East Basse Street San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: We always enjoy eating there. We think the food is great!

This is a nice neighborhood restaurant. The food is standard fare, but not memorable. The kitchen was efficient, but I can't see why they charge $8 to split a dish. The prime rib looked great, and my dinner guest said it was very succulent. He enjoyed the brusselsprout salad as well. I had the Dungeness Crab Louie, and that was a bit disappointing. The dressing was great though, and they will serve it on the side. The kids ordered macaroni and cheese, and I was surprised it came out in such a big bowl. Neither of the kids finished it, and I felt like we could have split one order for them both. The highlight of the night was the dessert that the waitress brought out for the birthday boy! It was a huge piece of ice cream cake!
Fabulous food, flavors just pop in your mouth. Excellent cocktails.
Love every aspect of this sweet little spot...everyone that works there is so amazing and friendly!! Highly recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy a good meal great atmosphere and great service

column4: 1920 Squaw Valley Road Olympic Valley, CA  96146
column13: made a reservation for jakes in tahoe city for Aug 30 at 7 pm. made the reservation before noon the 30th. When we arrived, they had no record of our reservation? They were able to seat us so worked out anyway.

Undoubtably the best dining experience available in Portland. If you want to see how a restaurant should be go to the Portland City Grill. The Management and the Chef have developed teams that excel in the front of the house and back. The food....superb, imaginative, creative, delicious. A blend of flavors and nuances that delight, excite and leave you wondering why others cannot prepare food this good. The service...the best in Portland. Hands down, the best in Portland. Attentive, polite and professional. From the Host Staff to the Servers to the Management, everyone displayed professionalism in their jobs. This is where you go when you want to impress your friends, business associates or significant other.
My group and I thought the food and service was fantastic, in a great setting.

My friends GPS gave him directions to the restaurant on the other side of town. The staff was very nice and attentive to me while I waited the 40 minutes until he arrived. We had the crusted halibut that was very tasty and cooked well. I loved the New England Chowder but neither one of us liked the Manhattan fish chowder very well. Other than that, super dining experience and we will be back.

column4: 9699 SW Washtington Square Road Tigard, OR  97223
column13: There was 10 in our party. The food took a very long time to arrive (longer than it should have) and one person in our party asked for sugar three times and never got it. Sad. That being said, the food was very good. Mixed review.

column4: 1125 SE Division Street Suite 102 Portland, OR  97202
column13: A wonderful and most special dinner was had by the 6 of us. The food was AMAZING - we had the Beet Tartare, Mushrooms and trumpet mushroom fries with sauce for appetizers. Cocktails are tasty and creative and the service was exceptional. I had the Deep Cornmeal Pie and others at my table had the Gnocchi and the Manicotti...all were devoured. I will be back for sure!

column1: Q on the Riverwalk - Hyatt Regency
column13: I was suspicious of a bbq restaraunt in a major hotel and I should have followed my instincts: we ordered the baby back ribs and when they arived the presentation was appealing however the ribs were tasteless with a blah sauce. Our server was great and the wine ist was acceptable. If Q can ramp up the food, this could be a geat dining experience.

My wife and I had a very special evening celebrating and our dinner at Red Star was superb!Our waiter, Rusty, was energetic, entertaining and very informative about weaving our way through the dining experience.He did an amazing job and at the end of dinner we discovered that he only recently started working at the Red Star. His level of service and knowledge of the menu rivaled that of the servers at Jake's!
Comsistently great food from Chef Michael since he opened. Some turnover on the service side noted on this visit, but servers have always seemed professional and knowledgeable about the concept.
Food was excellent will be going again!

Appetizers were wonderful for the most part. Dungeness crab cakes were great, oysters were great, steak tartar however was mediocre. Chef's Special Rockfish was good, but overpriced. Had rockfish at a local restaurant for almost half the price that was better. The halibut was dry, overseasoned and overpriced. This was my second time here. First time was really good. This time, not so much. Wont recommend. Will not return. Will still recommend the steak house though.
Attentive service without being overly fussy, great menu options.. Incredibly good meal

WE've been fans of Rio Grill (as well as their sister restaurants, Montrio and Tarpy's) for decades, and were delighted to see our favorite waitress is still at Rio as a hostess. We brought 4 newcomers to Rio, and all thought it was a great choice! I had the duck, a first time experience for me there - don't remember it being on the menu before - and it was superb! My husband stuck with his favorite - the penne pasta with shrimp and peas in a creole sauce - and said it was as good as ever. We will continue to visit Rio on every trip to the Carmel area - they pay attention to details and care about good service and good food!
The ambiance was excellent; we were seated at a table next to the river. The heat lamp provided the necessary warmth. Meal quality varied; some items were excellent, others less so.

Difficult to find parking was our first impression. We had made reservations, but weren't asked when we arrived. Server brought the 'lemon water' I requested without lemon--twice. Every other table got bread; we had to ask for ours. The entrees took a LONG time to come. The food was average, nothing special. The salmon with lobster sauce that I had was the special. It tasted like BBQ sauce, but the salmon was pretty good. I would consider coming back for lunch if we got an outdoor table; but, probably won't come back for dinner. Unimpressive,

The goat cheese and fig crostini wasn't toasted; Tuna Roll was pretty tasteless without the super salty soy sauce. The teaspoon size clumps of candied hazelnuts in the strawberry salad could have broken a tooth. The a tomato, bean (3) squash soup was completely blah of taste. The Miso Salmon with Gingered Rice was nothing memorable. The cut of fish was so thin I was reminded of a low grade pink salmon. The broccolini was among the toughest I've ever ever eaten. The Lamb Ossobucco on a bed of parmesan polenta was completely sad. The lamb was totally overcooked, tasteless and grizzly. Of all the lamb we've eaten around the world, this was the absolute worst. The polenta was runny and not very flavorful. Our wait staff, Cassie was superb

first waitress was like a robot; with little personality; did not make us feel like this was a special dining place; but was repalced by the waiter Henry who changed our opinion. He was quite professional; what one would expect of a place like this. ordred the carnitas, but got an end cut that was quite fatty and very little was eatable. Henry finaly made it back around to check on things and when we explained the problem he immeately exchanged the entire plate. very nice, but that was half way thru the meal and so she was begining when i was ending. friday special grilled prokchop was quite large and very good. not a good first impression.
Robin's is a "must" in Cambria!
The restaurant was too noisy. We took some family from out of town to dinner there and we had trouble carrying a conversation. It was way too loud around us. Wouldn't go back for interactions.
A great spot to have a brunch on the way to Big Sur. Quite pricey but the view and the ambiance is worth.

Not a professional restaurant. Really should not be on open table. We had a group Of 12. This was for a business dinner.There is not ambiance. It is a store front with a bunch of metal tables and chairs.No decor, period.Wait staff nice, polite, but absolutely not trained nor professional. Food was fine, presentations poor. I Had aChicken in in wine sauce, that was poorly platedAnd the presentation, there wasn't presentation. It looked very bad on the plate. Bluntly, not a restaurant for folks looking to entertain customers.

We had not been to Roots in over a year since our last visit was disappointing. However, this time the filet mignon was excellent and although as other reviews mentioned the prices can be a little high, I don't mind paying that if the steak is done properly. The service was also noteworthy. I would definitely recommend it again to friends.
good spot food & service all good

column4: 7 W. Carrillo St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: After reading so many great reviews, decided to try Roy for a birthday celebration. In addition to ordering two other satisfactory though unexceptional entrees (caprese salad and salmon), we ordered their Harris Ranch filet mignon; this turned out to be tough and almost inedible. Returned the steak to server with explanation of same. Server offered to have another steak prepared in its place. However, concerned that the quality might be similarly low, we declined. Expected to receive a credit on our bill instead, but after leaving restaurant, in checking with the member of our party who had treated everyone, learned that our server had not deducted anything from bill. Not very professional or customer friendly.
